sen.j: 伏原家（ふせはらけ）は清原氏の嫡流舟橋家の分家である堂上家。
sen.e: Fusehara family was a toshoke (the hereditary lineage of court nobles allowed to enter the tenjonoma in the palace) that was a cadet family of Funabashi family which was a direct line of descent of the Kiyohara clan.

The Fusehara family was a toshoke (the hereditary lineage of court nobles allowed to enter the tenjonoma in the palace) that was a branch family of the Funabashi family in direct line of descent from the Kiyohara clan.

sen.j: 後水尾天皇の斡旋により、舟橋家の当主の（従四位上・式部省）舟橋秀賢朝臣の次男伏原賢忠（かたただ）（従二位・大蔵省）（1637年-1705年）を分家させることとし、伏原家の家名を名乗る。
sen.e: Through mediation by Emperor Gomizunoo, Katatada FUSEHARA (Junii (Junior Second Rank), Okurasho (Ministry of Finance))(1637-1705), who was the second son of Hidekata FUNAHASHI (Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), Shikibusho (Ministry of Ceremony)), who was the family head of the Funahashi family was made to establish a branch using the family name of Fusehara family.
